alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Franklin; Madison; Pickaway (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 5:14PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WESTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHEASTERN FAYETTE, NORTHWESTERN PICKAWAY AND SOUTHEASTERN MADISON COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 514 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Mount Sterling, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Grove City, Upper Arlington, Hilliard, Jefferson, West Jefferson, Mount Sterling, Ohio State University, Lake Darby, Grandview Heights, Obetz, Commercial Point, Urbancrest, Valleyview, Marble Cliff, Harrisburg, Orient, Lockbourne, Chenoweth and Clintonville. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 86 and 101. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 77 and 115. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
